review_blob: The first beer tasted in a delightful evening of stating and scoring Belgian Trappists beers. I dont read the beer notes above before marking which probably explains why my deScription differs greatly from what I am supposed to taste - maybe its my palate..? Anyway, I got some lovely rich velvety chocolate / coffee undertones which complemented perfectly the dark brown colour.

A striking bottle hides a rich , sweet and sumptuous brew and a barely noticeable 10.5 alcohol content. Certainly not a session beer but one to crack open when you want to remember what real Belgian strong ale should taste like.

A really enjoyable strong ale, my bottle indicated 9.5% not 9 as stated above. High alcohol content is disguised by a beautifully smooth taste which leaves no residue, uncommon for beers of this strength. By no means a session beer but certainly one to look out for next time your in Belgium or at a Belgian beer festival.

This was the penultimate beer in a Belgian beer tasting evening, and so taste buds were somewhat spent by the time this golden light beer dropped onto my tongue. That said it was very impressive, despite being the weakest of all 8 beers tasted, it was memorable and had a lovely fruity taste, bit reminiscent of hoegaarden (I can hear the purists groan). Certainly one Id look out for again.
